revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Google |model=Fiber Network Box |revision=(GFRG110A) |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Actiontec |availability=common |fcc_date=06/13/2012 |fcc_id=LNQ802DRN |type=wireless router, ONT |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Marvell |cpu1_model=88F6560 |cpu1_cspeed=1.2 GHz |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=ESMT |fla1_model=F59L1G81A-25TI |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=Samsung |ram1_model=K4B2G1646C-HCH9 |expansion_if_types=Mini PCIe, |expansion_minipcie_num=2 |jtag=yes,, 14-pin header,, unpopulated, |serial=yes,, 6-pin header,, populated,, 3.3V TTL,, (115200 8N1) |wi1_module=Actiontec 802DRN |wi1_module_if=Mini PCIe (dual) |wi1_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi1_chip1_model=88W8764 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module=Actiontec 802DRN |wi2_module_if=Mini PCIe (dual) |wi2_chip1_brand=Marvell |wi2_chip1_model=88W8764 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Marvell |eth_chip2_model=88E1545 |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2A, 4.2V-16V Synchronous Step-down Converter;MPS;MP1492;;2;,,, Quadruple 2-Input Positive-And Gate;Texas Instruments;SN74LVC08A;;1;,,, 2A Synchronous Buck Regulator;Alpha & Omega;AOZ1020A;;2; |flags=GPON, fan, heatsink |802dot11_protocols=abgn |oui=F8:8F:CA |oui_eth=F8:8F:CA }} {{TagLine|Google Fiber Network Box}} :[http://support.google.com/fiber/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=2597690 Support page] :[https://code.google.com/p/gfiber-gfrg100/ Open source and GPL code for the device (on '''Google''' Code)]
Per the source, this device is using 88F6560 (''AVANTA'' family) with 88W8764 radios. :The firmware is [http://www.jungo.com/products/openrg-uniform-gateway-middleware/ OpenRG] based. .. the device seems to be quite similar :to the [[Actiontec MI424WR rev Iâ€Ž]], which is also referenced in the source.. :and thus likely uses an OpenRG based firmware as well (but I don't feel :like downloading it to confirm this ATM), UBoot bootloader, NAND flash
The main board is silkscreened with "Actiontec" and "06694A" in the FCC photos. :There is a [[Marvell]] GbE Switch / PHY on the board. The SoC is covered by a heatsink. :As the SoC is ''AVANTA'' based, the device is likely using the internal SoC switch core..
===Reviews=== *[http://gigaom.com/2012/08/01/google-fiber-check-out-the-in-home-set-up-and-equipment/ View of a ''Network Box'' in a Google Fiber demo location] :''These screen shots show that the device is most likely made by Actiontec for Google.'' :Per the system information, ''Platform:'' Actiontec Rev-K Board :MACs have been fully censored from Web UI screenshots :This revision appears to have a Fiber interface (w/ a ''NeoPhotonics'' module per :the FCC images), though this appears to be omitted on production models.
*[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r2vns_SVl14 Views of the ''Google Fiber boxes''], but no label shots of anything of substance. *[http://i.imgur.com/D1HEI.jpg Censored label shot with FCC ID] (via [http://www.reddit.com/r/AMA/comments/139ely/i_have_google_fiber_installed_and_in_use_ama_mod/ Reddit]) - F8:8F:CA OUI
===Serial=== Appears to have same 1x6 pin 3.3v 115200 baud UART connector as GFRG100.
==Images== <gallery caption="from Google"> File:Google network-box.jpg|main File:Google network-box back.png|back </gallery>[[Has images::external| ]] <gallery caption="from the 802DRN FCC images"> File:Google Fiber Network Box presumed board top from 802DRN FCC images.jpg|the presumed board File:Actiontec TwinTower-1A 802DRN shield off.jpg|wireless module, shield off </gallery>[[Has images::internal| ]]
__NOTOC__
